project.name: Gentoo 3D print
project.description: Packages for 3d printing.

project.name: Gentoo ALSA Project
project.description: The Gentoo ALSA Project maintains packages released by ALSA upstream.

project.name: AMD64 Project
project.description: The AMD64 Project is devoted to providing stable, secure and up-to-date releases of Gentoo for the AMD64 and EM64T processor families.

project.name: Gentoo Linux ARM Development
project.description: The ARM Development Project is devoted to keeping Gentoo in good shape on the ARM architecture.

project.name: Gentoo Linux ARM64 development
project.description: The ARM64 project is devoted to getting and keeping Gentoo in good shape on the ARM AArch64 architecture.

project.name: Gentoo Accessibility Project
project.description: The Gentoo Accessibility Project provides a way for Gentoo developers in various teams to coordinate efforts to make Gentoo more accessible to users who have disabilities.

project.name: Gentoo Resources for Ada
project.description: This project provides support for Ada compilers and libraries in Portage. At present a gnat compiler is provided: gnat-gpl by AdaCore.

project.name: Gentoo Linux Alpha Development
project.description: The Gentoo/Alpha Arch Team is devoted to keeping Gentoo in good shape on the Alpha architecture.

project.name: Alt
project.description: Provide Gentoo solutions for non-GNU/Linux platforms.

project.name: Gentoo Antivirus Project
project.description: The Antivirus Project maintains antivirus-related packages.

project.name: Gentoo Apache Project
project.description: The Apache project is responsible for maintaining the Apache httpd server in Gentoo, and many of its modules. We also maintain a build infrastructure so that other modules may be easily added in a standard way to Apache.

project.name: Artwork
project.description: The Artwork project manages Gentoo artwork and related assets. This includes wallpapers, logos, themes, icons sets, etc.

project.name: Gentoo Astronomy Project
project.description: The Astronomy Project handles astronomy, astrophysics, cosmology related activities in Gentoo.

project.name: Gentoo Linux Security Audit Project
project.description: The Gentoo Linux Security Audit Project is focused upon auditing packages for security issues. The aim of the project is to audit as many of the packages available through Gentoo Linux stable Portage tree as possible for potential flaws.

project.name: BSD Project
project.description: Maintains BSD userspace and some BSD-origin packages

member.name: Alexis Ballier
member.role: Bearded one. Helping out reviewing mostly.

project.name: Gentoo Base System
project.description: The Base System Project provides an umbrella project for keeping the system tools, libraries, compilers and layout consistent for all the various architectures under Gentoo Linux.

member.name: Doug Goldstein
member.role: Misc stuff that needs to get done

member.name: Patrick McLean
member.role: Misc stuff that needs to get done

member.name: Robin Johnson
member.role: Specialized block devices and lots of other miscellaneous stuff

member.name: William Hubbs
member.role: Misc stuff that needs to get done

project.name: Gentoo Biology Project
project.description: The Biology Project handles all biology related activities in Gentoo.

project.name: Bug cleaners
project.description: The Gentoo Bug Cleaners project aims to clean up the oldest bugs in Bugzilla.

project.name: Bug Wranglers
project.description: The Gentoo Bug Wranglers project controls, describes the tasks to be carried out and goals to be achieved for everyone who wrangles bugs on Gentoo's bug tracker.

project.name: Gentoo C++ Project
project.description: Maintaining C++ libraries and tools

project.name: Catalyst
project.description: The Gentoo Catalyst Project develops and supports the Catalyst release building tool. Catalyst has been designed to be easy to use, customize, and maintain. It is also used in other Gentoo projects, such as GNAP.

project.name: Gentoo Chemistry Project
project.description: The Chemistry Project handles all chemistry related activities in Gentoo.

project.name: Chromium in Gentoo Project
project.description: The Chromium in Gentoo project manages the Chromium-related ebuilds within Gentoo.

project.name: Cinnamon
project.description: The goal of the Cinnamon project is to maintain Cinnamon related packages in the main Gentoo repository.

project.name: Cjk
project.description: Chinese/Japanese/Korean support packages.

project.name: Gentoo Cluster Project
project.description: The Cluster Project handles both HPC and HA related activities in Gentoo.

project.name: Gentoo Community Relations
project.description: Community Relations handles many personnel-related tasks, solving conflicts and also ensuring that the Gentoo Code of Conduct and proper and professional behavior is followed across Gentoo's borders.

project.name: Community Resources
project.description: Community Resources is an umbrella project comprising the Recruiters, Retirement and Comminity Relations subprojects. It acts as a central place for all the human-resources related projects.

project.name: Gentoo Common Lisp Project
project.description: The Gentoo Common Lisp Project handles Common Lisp related packages in the Gentoo package tree.

project.name: Gentoo Containers
project.description: Gentoo Containers provides minimal container images for a variety of container formats so that users can have a consistent experience when building application specific containers.

project.name: Gentoo Council
project.description: The elected Gentoo Council decides on global issues and policies that affect multiple projects in Gentoo.

project.name: Gentoo Cron Project
project.description: The Gentoo Cron Project maintains cron-related packages.

project.name: Gentoo Crossdev maintainers
project.description: Crossdev is a small wrapper script around emerge to build cross-toolchains.

project.name: Crypto
project.description: Project for maintaining crypto related packages

project.name: Gentoo Debian Tools Project
project.description: Maintains tools used to build Debian-like distributions and related packages.

project.name: Gentoo Desktop Miscellaneous Project
project.description: Maintains various small utilities for X11 that do not fit any other category.

project.name: Devmanual
project.description: The Devmanual subproject is tasked with maintaining and updating the Gentoo Development Guide https://devmanual.gentoo.org/

project.name: Gentoo Dotnet Project
project.description: The Dotnet Project handles the development using the C# language. More specifically, it is often oriented with the mono development environment.

project.name: Elections
project.description: Gentoo Elections Project gathers all the information necessary to conduct elections in Gentoo.

project.name: Gentoo Electronics Project
project.description: The Electronics Project handles all electronics related activities in Gentoo.

project.name: Gentoo Emacs project
project.description: The Gentoo Emacs project handles Emacs and Elisp related packages in the Gentoo package tree.

project.name: Embedded Gentoo
project.description: Embedded Gentoo brings the flexibility of Gentoo to embedded systems. The project is responsible for overseeing the build infrastructure for creating images to be installed onto embedded systems.

project.name: Project Enlightenment
project.description: Project Enlightenment maintains efl packages including e17

project.name: eselect configuration and management tool
project.description: eselect is Gentoo's modular framework for configuration and administration utilities.

project.name: eudev
project.description: eudev is a device manager for the Linux kernel

project.name: Fonts
project.description: The fonts project handles all fonts-related issues within the Gentoo project.

project.name: Gentoo Linux Forums
project.description: The Gentoo Forums are a source of support for the Gentoo user community. It allows users to post support questions that can be answered by developers and other users alike.

project.name: Gentoo Foundation
project.description: The Gentoo Foundation, Inc. provides the legal and financial base for the Gentoo project.

member.name: Robin Johnson
member.role: Officer: Assistant Infra Liaison, Assistant Treasurer

project.name: Gentoo Freedesktop Project
project.description: Maintains projects produced by freedesktop.org

project.name: Gentoo Linux Enhancement Proposals
project.description: The GLEP project manages Gentoo Linux Enhancement Proposals.

project.name: Gentoo GNOME Desktop
project.description: The Gentoo Gnome Project aims to bring the current and complete GNOME Desktop Environment to Gentoo.

project.name: Gentoo GNU Emacs project
project.description: The Gentoo GNU Emacs project handles GNU Emacs and related packages in the Gentoo package tree.

project.name: Gentoo GNUstep Project
project.description: The Gentoo GNUstep Project maintains GNUstep environment (gnustep-base) and packages (gnustep-libs, gnustep-applications/)

project.name: GStreamer package maintainers
project.description: The GStreamer project maintains packages associated with the upstream GStreamer project and associated Gentoo tooling

project.name: Gentoo Games Project
project.description: The Gentoo Games Project manages the game categories (dev-games, games-*) in Portage

project.name: Genkernel
project.description: The Genkernel project handles the maintenance and development of [https://packages.gentoo.org/packages/sys-kernel/genkernel sys-kernel/genkernel].

project.name: Gentoo Keys
project.description: Gentoo Keys is a Python based project that aims to manage the OpenPGP keys used for validation on users and Gentoo's infrastructure servers.

project.name: Gentoostats
project.description: Gentoostats project maintains and develops the "gentoostats" statistics collection software for Gentoo machines

project.name: Gentoo Geosciences Project
project.description: The Geosciences Project handles all geosciences activities in Gentoo.

project.name: GitHub
project.description: Support team for the Gentoo organization on GitHub and the related resources (mirrors, pull requests).

project.name: Graphics Project
project.description: The Graphics Project maintains media-gfx and related packages.

project.name: Gentoo Linux HPPA Development
project.description: The Gentoo HPPA project is designed to bring the Gentoo GNU/Linux operating system to the HP Precision Architecture platforms. We aim to provide a usable computing environment for your various HPPA related endeavors.

project.name: Gentoo Hardened
project.description: Hardened Gentoo is a project which oversees the research, implementation, and maintenance of security oriented projects for Gentoo Linux.

member.name: Anthony G. Basile
member.role: Hardened sources, Hardened uClibc, Hardened musl

project.name: Hardened musl
project.description: This subproject aims to port the hardened tool chain to musl based systems for a variety of architectures. The project treats musl as an alternative to glibc and uClibc, and not necessarily as "embedded".

project.name: Hardened uClibc
project.description: This subproject aims to port both tool chain and kernel hardening to uClibc based systems for a variety of architectures. The project treats uClibc as an alternative to glibc, and not necessarily as "embedded".

project.name: Gentoo Haskell
project.description: Support Haskell programming language ecosystem on Gentoo systems.

project.name: Gentoo Linux IA-64 Development
project.description: The IA-64 Development Project is devoted to keeping Gentoo in good shape on the IA-64 architecture.

project.name: Gentoo Infrastructure
project.description: The Gentoo Infrastructure team provides and develops services for the Gentoo developer and user community, ensuring availability, security and functionality.

member.name: Jorge Manuel B. S. Vicetto
member.role: General system administration, Release Engineering liaison

project.name: Installer
project.description: After many years of an installer being absent from Gentoo, it is time to start work on creating a perfect Gentoo installer.

project.name: Integrity, Compliance, and Reporting
project.description: The integrity subproject aims to integrate and maintain technologies related to system integrity within Gentoo Hardened. Although initially focused on Linux IMA/EVM, this will extend towards other integrity, compliance and reporting technologies.

project.name: Java
project.description: We maintain everything Java-related in Gentoo, that is, most of dev-java/* and also packages in categories like dev-util, www-servers etc.

project.name: Gentoo KDE Project
project.description: The primary goal of the Gentoo KDE project is to provide support for all packages produced by the KDE Community.

project.name: Kerberos
project.description: The Gentoo Kerberos project aims to maintain kerberos related packages in Gentoo.

project.name: Gentoo Kernel Project
project.description: The Gentoo Kernel Project aims to deliver the best possible experience from its sources across all supported architectures.

project.name: Gentoo Linux Kernel Security Project
project.description: The Gentoo Linux Kernel Security Project handles patching our many kernel sources and informing our users about global kernel security status.

project.name: Gentoo LDAP Project
project.description: The Gentoo LDAP Project maintains LDAP-related packages.

project.name: LLVM
project.description: Support project for LLVM, clang and the related packages.

project.name: Gentoo LXDE Project
project.description: The LXDE project manages ebuilds in Gentoo for [http://lxde.org/ LXDE], the Lightweight X11 Desktop Environment, and handles related issues.

project.name: LXQt
project.description: Maintains LXQt DE related packages.

project.name: Layman Overlay Manager
project.description: Layman is a tool to manage overlays installed on a system. It can add, sync, and delete overlays

project.name: Lemote Yeeloong Gentoo Desktop
project.description: The Lemote Yeeloong Gentoo Desktop aim to provide a ready to install XFCE4 base desktop to the Yeeloong netbook.

project.name: LibreSSL
project.description: LibreSSL is a fork of, and drop in replacement for OpenSSL. Primary development is done in OpenBSD, but it is ported to Linux as well. The LibreSSL project aims to bring support for this alternative SSL provider to Gentoo Linux.

project.name: Gentoo Licenses Project
project.description: The Gentoo Licenses Project tries to make heads & tails of license terms.

project.name: Gentoo Lisp Project
project.description: The Gentoo Lisp Project handles Lisp related packages in the Gentoo package tree.

project.name: Gentoo LiveCD Project
project.description: Maintains packages used in the creation of LiveCDs.

project.name: Gentoo Linux m68k Development
project.description: The m68k Development Project is devoted to keeping Gentoo in good shape on the m68k architecture.

project.name: Gentoo MATE Desktop
project.description: The Gentoo MATE Project aims to bring the current and complete MATE Desktop Environment to Gentoo.

project.name: Gentoo/MIPS Port
project.description: Gentoo/MIPS is a port of the Gentoo GNU/Linux and the Gentoo Portage package management system to mips-based platforms.

project.name: Gentoo ML Project
project.description: The Gentoo ML Project maintains packages related to the ML programming language family.

project.name: Gentoo Mathematics Project
project.description: The Mathematics Project handles all math related activities in Gentoo.

project.name: Mentors
project.description: The Mentors project acts as a matchmaking service between prospective developers and volunteer mentors.

project.name: Gentoo Mozilla Team
project.description: Mozilla and related applications

project.name: Multilib
project.description: The Gentoo multilib project aims to provide means to build Gentoo packages for multiple ABIs.

project.name: MySQL
project.description: This project maintains MySQL and its derivatives

project.name: Net-Mail
project.description: The Gentoo Net-Mail project aims to maintain email related packages in Gentoo.

project.name: Netifrc Project
project.description: This project is for the development and maintenance of the netifrc network configuration scripts

project.name: Gentoo network monitoring and analysis project
project.description: Maintaining network monitoring and analysis libraries and programs

project.name: News
project.description: Presenting news as it develops, the News project is intended to provide the Gentoo community a stream of information regarding changes in the Gentoo universe.

project.name: Gentoo Office project
project.description: The Office project manages the office implementations and related packages in Gentoo.

project.name: OpenRC
project.description: OpenRC is a dependency based init system that works with the system provided init program, normally /sbin/init.

project.name: Openstack
project.description: Openstack is a virtualization orchestration suite that allows the creation and management of cloud infrastructures.

project.name: The #gentoo Operators Project
project.description: The [irc://irc.gentoo.org/gentoo #gentoo] Operators project describes the tasks and policies carried out by the operators of the #gentoo channel on the Freenode network.

project.name: Gentoo Overlays
project.description: The Gentoo Overlays project is responsible for the administration of the overlays and the overlays.gentoo.org / repos.gentoo.org websites.

member.name: NP-Hardass
member.role: Hosted Overlays for Developers and Projects

project.name: Pluggable Authentication Method maintenance
project.description: Pluggable Authentication Method is the main authentication method supported by Gentoo; the PAM maintenance project maintain the related software.

project.name: PHP
project.description: This project maintains PHP itself as well as the PHP extensions and libraries

project.name: Package Manager Specification
project.description: The Package Manager Specification aims to document what is required of a Gentoo package manager, and what ebuilds may assume about their environment.

project.name: Gentoo Perl Project
project.description: We maintain everything perlish in Gentoo.

project.name: Gentoo Physics Project
project.description: The Physics Project handles all physics related activities in Gentoo.

project.name: Planet Gentoo
project.description: Planet Gentoo provides a central aggregation of developers' blogs, to keep users and other developers informed of what they are working on.

project.name: Portage
project.description: The Portage Development Project is devoted to maintaining and updating Portages core functionality and utilities.

project.name: Gentoo Portage tools team
project.description: The Gentoo Portage tools team develops and maintains a number of tools that use Portage's APIs or perform actions relating to the maintenance of the Portage tree ecosystem.

project.name: PostgreSQL
project.description: This project is focused on maintaining ebuilds and utilities that are closely tied to PostgreSQL including PostgreSQL itself.

project.name: Gentoo Linux PowerPC Development
project.description: The PowerPC Development Project is devoted to keeping Gentoo in good shape on both 32-bit and 64-bit PowerPC architecture.

project.name: Gentoo Prefix
project.description: To bring out the virtues of Gentoo on different operating systems, the Gentoo Prefix project develops and maintains a way of installing Gentoo systems in a non-standard location, designated by a "prefix".

project.name: Gentoo Printing Project
project.description: Printing related stuff, net-print category (+ some extra stuff).

project.name: Gentoo ProAudio Project
project.description: The Gentoo ProAudio Project maintains professional audio applications and related libraries.

project.name: Prolog
project.description: Maintains Prolog and logic programming language packages

project.name: Proxy Maintainers
project.description: Proxy Maintainers facilitates high quality user contributions and works to enhance user-developer cooperation in maintaining packages.

project.name: Public Relations
project.description: The Public Relations team improves Gentoo's visibility towards the rest of the world. We maintain presence on various web silos such as Facebook, Google+, and Twitter. Below you will find those responsible on a per-site basis.

member.name: Alice Ferrazzi
member.role: Facebook (admin), G+ (owner), Twitter, Events, Telegram (admin), Slack (admin)

member.name: Matthew Marchese
member.role: Cafepress store, Facebook (admin), G+ (primary owner), Twitter, Telegram (admin), Slack (admin)

project.name: Python
project.description: The Python project maintains dev-lang/python and most of dev-python/*.

project.name: Gentoo QEMU Project
project.description: The Gentoo QEMU Project maintains packages related to QEMU.

project.name: Gentoo Qt Project
project.description: The Qt project handles the Qt ebuilds available in Gentoo's portage and the qt overlay. It also maintains various Qt packages and libraries that don't have dedicated maintainers.

project.name: Quality Assurance
project.description: The Gentoo Quality Assurance team

project.name: Gentoo ROS Project
project.description: The Gentoo ROS Project maintains packages for the Robot Operating System.

project.name: RSBAC
project.description: This project manages the RSBAC support within Gentoo. This includes providing kernels with RSBAC support (loosely based on the hardened-sources), administration utilities to manage and write strong Gentoo-specific policies.

project.name: Radio
project.description: This project maintains packages related to sending and receiving radio transmissions.

project.name: Gentoo Developer Recruiters
project.description: The Recruiters subproject provides a central location for information about developer recruitment and recruiter policy.

project.name: Release Engineering
project.description: Release Engineering ("RelEng") is the official Gentoo project focused on coordinating and improving the creation of official media releases of Gentoo Linux and the associated tools used by the installation process.

project.name: RelEng GRS
project.description: The Gentoo Reference System (GRS) Suite is a set of tools for building and maintaining a well defined Gentoo system in which all choices in building the system are predefined in configuration files housed on a central git repository.

project.name: Repository mirror and CI
project.description: The repo-mirror-ci project aims to run basic QA checks on all listed Gentoo repositories and provide syncing mirrors for them (with pre-generated metadata cache).

project.name: Gentoo Ruby Project
project.description: The Ruby project maintains packages for Ruby implementations, libraries and development tools. This project also maintains the RubyGems package, the de facto standard for packaging Ruby projects.

project.name: Gentoo Rust Project
project.description: The Gentoo Rust Project maintains the Rust toolchain and its related packages.

project.name: Gentoo Linux s390 Development
project.description: The s390 Development Project is devoted to keeping Gentoo in good shape on the s390 architecture.

project.name: SELinux
project.description: This project manages SELinux support in Gentoo. This includes providing kernels with SELinux support, providing patches to userland utilities, writing strong Gentoo-specific default profiles, and maintaining a good default set of policies.

project.name: Gentoo Linux SPARC Development
project.description: Gentoo/SPARC is a Gentoo project designed to bring the Gentoo GNU/Linux operating system to the SPARC and UltraSPARC platforms. Gentoo/SPARC aims to provide a usable server and desktop environment for your various SPARC related endeavors.

project.name: SUSE
project.description: This project manages all various rpm based tools for working with OBS and rpmbuild

project.name: Samba
project.description: This project maintains packages related to Samba suit.

project.name: Gentoo Sandbox Team
project.description: The Gentoo Sandbox Team maintains sandbox-related tools and libraries

project.name: Gentoo Scheme Project
project.description: The Gentoo Scheme Project handles Scheme related packages in the Gentoo package tree.

project.name: Gentoo Science Project
project.description: The Gentoo Science project manages science and mathematics related activities in Gentoo

project.name: Gentoo Security Project
project.description: The Gentoo Security Project's mission is to ensure that vulnerabilities in software accessible through the Portage tree are found and fixed in a timely manner, so that our users remain protected against known vulnerabilities.

project.name: Gentoo Shell Tools Project
project.description: Maintains miscellaneous tools used from within a shell environment.

project.name: Gentoo Sound project
project.description: The sound team provides and maintains sound applications and drivers.

member.name: Tony Vroon
member.role: Lead ( Herd Lead, Audacious and plugins, libnjb )

project.name: Gentoo Linux SuperH (sh) Development
project.description: The SuperH Development Project is devoted to keeping Gentoo in good shape on the SuperH architecture.

project.name: Gentoo Sysadmin Project
project.description: The Gentoo Sysadmin Project maintains various system administration packages.

project.name: systemd
project.description: The Gentoo systemd project aims to bring Gentoo users the best experience in using systemd as an sysvinit/OpenRC alternative.

project.name: Gentoo Tcltk Project
project.description: Gentoo tcltk packages.

project.name: Gentoo TeX Project
project.description: The TeX project maintains ebuilds for TeXLive and TeX related packages. This includes [https://packages.gentoo.org/packages/app-text/texlive app-text/texlive], the [https://packages.gentoo.org/categories/dev-texlive dev-texlive] category, most of [https://packages.gentoo.org/categories/dev-tex dev-tex] and a few others.

project.name: Theology
project.description: The theology project maintains religious, genealogy, and humanities-related packages

project.name: Tinderbox cluster
project.description: A tinderbox that the guest code can run on multiple setups.

project.name: Gentoo Toolchain Project
project.description: Manages gcc/binutils/glibc and other toolchain-related packages

project.name: Treecleaner
project.description: The Tree Cleaning Team is primarily concerned with removing unmaintained and broken packages from the tree.

project.name: Udev
project.description: The purpose of this project is to maintain sys-fs/udev and related packages.

project.name: Undertakers
project.description: The Community Relations Undertakers project handles developer retirement, both when developers announce their retirement as well as due to developer inactivity.

project.name: Gentoo VDR project
project.description: The Gentoo VDR Project maintains and updates the VDR packages in the portage tree. It integrates them with Gentoo as tight as possible. VDR is the abbreviation for Video Disk Recorder.

project.name: Gentoo Video project
project.description: The Video team strives to provide users with the best multimedia experience through providing encoding tools and media players. We do so by maintaining various video based applications including MPlayer, Xine, and Transcode.

project.name: Gentoo Vim Project
project.description: The Gentoo Vim Project maintains Vim-related packages.

project.name: Gentoo Virtualization Project
project.description: The Gentoo Virtualization Project maintains packages shared between the different virtualization (sub-)projects and provides documentation and tools to the user to make Gentoo a first choice platform as both host and guest system.

project.name: Gentoo VMware Project
project.description: The Gentoo VMware project ("vmware") is the official Gentoo project for the maintenance and development of VMware and VMware-related products in the Gentoo package repository.

project.name: Gentoo Webapps
project.description: The web-apps team maintains web applications, an eclass to facilitate writing ebuilds for these packages, and the webapp-config tool.

project.name: Website maintainers
project.description: The Website team maintains the Gentoo website and develops new sites for the community.

project.name: Wiki
project.description: The wiki project oversees the community and the content surrounding wiki.gentoo.org

project.name: Wine
project.description: Maintenance of Wine and Wine-related Packages

project.name: Gentoo wxWidgets Project
project.description: The Gentoo wxWidgets Project maintains wxGTK and wxPython related packages and applications.

project.name: X11
project.description: The X11 project manages the X implementations and related packages in Portage.

project.name: Gentoo Linux x86 Architecture Development
project.description: The Gentoo Linux/x86 Project works to keep Gentoo the most up to date and secure x86 distribution available.

project.name: Gentoo XEmacs project
project.description: The Gentoo XEmacs project handles XEmacs and related packages in the Gentoo package tree.

project.name: Gentoo Xen Project
project.description: The Gentoo Xen Project maintains packages related to Xen.

project.name: Gentoo Xfce Project
project.description: The Gentoo Xfce Project aims to bring the current and complete Xfce desktop environment to Gentoo.
